me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.prebuilt

Class CircleSurround

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.pathfinder2.prebuilt.CircleSurround

  • public class CircleSurround
extends java.lang.Object
    A prebuilt utility class designed to "surround" a circle. Basically, the idea here is that you might want to have your robot automatically target the closest point along a circle. The center of your robot should be exactly distance away from the target point. Additionally, your robot can orient itself so that it's facing directly towards the center. So cool!

    This class has both static and member types.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Method Detail

      • closestPoint

        public static PointXYZ closestPoint(PointXYZ robotPosition,
                                    PointXY center,
                                    double radius)
        Get the point along a circle closest to the robot.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the circle's center point.
        radius - the radius of the circle.
        Returns:
        the point along a circle closest to the robot. This point's heading will be facing towards the center of the circle.

      • closestPointBetweenAngles

        public static PointXYZ closestPointBetweenAngles(PointXYZ robotPosition,
                                                 PointXY center,
                                                 double radius,
                                                 Angle minimumAngle,
                                                 Angle maximumAngle)
        Get the closest point along a circle between two given angles. I don't really know how to explain this, so if you're confused, just look at the code and try and figure it out.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the circle's center point.
        radius - the radius of the circle.
        minimumAngle - the minimum angle.
        maximumAngle - the maximum angle.
        Returns:
        the point along a circle closest to the robot. This point's heading will be facing towards the center of the circle.

      • closestPointWithoutHeading

        public static PointXYZ closestPointWithoutHeading(PointXYZ robotPosition,
                                                  PointXY center,
                                                  double radius)
        Get the point along a circle closest to the robot. The returned point will have the same heading as the robot's position.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the circle's center point.
        radius - the radius of the circle.
        Returns:
        the point along a circle closest to the robot. This point's heading will be the same as the robot position.

      • closestPointWithCustomHeading

        public static PointXYZ closestPointWithCustomHeading(PointXYZ robotPosition,
                                                     PointXY center,
                                                     double radius,
                                                     Angle customHeading)
        Get the point along a circle closest to the robot. The returned point will have a custom heading, provided as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the circle's center point.
        radius - the radius of the circle.
        customHeading - the custom heading for the point to have.
        Returns:
        the point along a circle closest to the robot.

      • trajectoryToClosestPoint

        public static Trajectory trajectoryToClosestPoint(PointXYZ robotPosition,
                                                  PointXY center,
                                                  double radius,
                                                  double speed,
                                                  double tolerance,
                                                  Angle angleTolerance)
        Get a LinearTrajectory from the robot's current position to the closest point along the circle. This trajectory will make the robot face towards the center of the circle.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the center of the target circle.
        radius - the radius of the target circle.
        speed - the speed the trajectory should operate at.
        tolerance - the distance tolerance for the trajectory.
        angleTolerance - the angle tolerance for the trajectory.
        Returns:
        a LinearTrajectory from the robot's current position to the closest point along the circle.

      • trajectoryToClosestPointWithoutHeading

        public static Trajectory trajectoryToClosestPointWithoutHeading(PointXYZ robotPosition,
                                                                PointXY center,
                                                                double radius,
                                                                double speed,
                                                                double tolerance,
                                                                Angle angleTolerance)
        Get a LinearTrajectory from the robot's current position to the closest point along the circle. This trajectory will make the robot face the same direction that it started the trajectory in. In other words, it will keep the same heading.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the center of the target circle.
        radius - the radius of the target circle.
        speed - the speed the trajectory should operate at.
        tolerance - the distance tolerance for the trajectory.
        angleTolerance - the angle tolerance for the trajectory.
        Returns:
        a LinearTrajectory from the robot's current position to the closest point along the circle.

      • trajectoryToClosestPointWithHeading

        public static Trajectory trajectoryToClosestPointWithHeading(PointXYZ robotPosition,
                                                             PointXY center,
                                                             double radius,
                                                             double speed,
                                                             double tolerance,
                                                             Angle angleTolerance,
                                                             Angle customHeading)
        Get a LinearTrajectory from the robot's current position to the closest point along the circle. This trajectory will make the robot face towards whatever heading you provide.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the center of the target circle.
        radius - the radius of the target circle.
        speed - the speed the trajectory should operate at.
        tolerance - the distance tolerance for the trajectory.
        angleTolerance - the angle tolerance for the trajectory.
        customHeading - the angle the robot should face.
        Returns:
        a LinearTrajectory from the robot's current position to the closest point along the circle.

      • fastTrajectoryToClosestPoint

        public static Trajectory fastTrajectoryToClosestPoint(PointXYZ robotPosition,
                                                      PointXY center,
                                                      double radius,
                                                      double speed)
        Do the same thing as trajectoryToClosestPoint(PointXYZ, PointXY, double, double, double, Angle), but with a fast trajectory.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the center of the target circle.
        radius - the radius of the target circle.
        speed - the speed at which the trajectory should operate at.
        Returns:
        a FastTrajectory.

        Do the same thing as trajectoryToClosestPointWithoutHeading(PointXYZ, PointXY, double, double, double, Angle), but with a fast trajectory.
        Parameters:
        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the center of the target circle.
        radius - the radius of the target circle.
        speed - the speed at which the trajectory should operate at.
        Returns:
        a FastTrajectory.

        Do the same thing as trajectoryToClosestPointWithHeading(PointXYZ, PointXY, double, double, double, Angle, Angle), but with a fast trajectory.

        robotPosition - the robot's current position.
        center - the center of the target circle.
        radius - the radius of the target circle.

        a FastTrajectory.
